meanings.definition: Derived from more than one ancestral source.
meanings.sent1: The zoo displayed a polyphyletic collection of animals from various regions.
meanings.sent2: The polyphyletic origins of the ancient artifact puzzled the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: The polyphyletic family tree made for an interesting genealogy project.
meanings.sent4: Her diverse interests were like a polyphyletic bouquet of flowers, each with its own unique origin.
meanings.sent5: The polyphyletic nature of the music genre blended different styles seamlessly.

meanings.definition: Not derived from a single common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The polyphyletic species in the forest evolved independently over time.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the polyphyletic nature of the plant species in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The polyphyletic group of friends had surprisingly different backgrounds.
meanings.sent4: The polyphyletic languages in the region reflected a rich cultural history.
meanings.sent5: The polyphyletic origins of the folklore tales added depth to their meanings.
